instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00850 - CPUGT_PWM1
threads.message:
Hello,

currently I'm working on a water damaged 820-00850. There was corrosion on and around U7100 with a broken pad No 25. After trying to restore the pad i scratched too much and opened the underlying layer (GND). PP7103 is not shorted to ground but pin 25 of U7100 is now... Any ideas how the fix this the best way? Is it possible to short CPUGT_PWM1 to CPUGT_PWM2?
The rest of the board seems to be good. I get ALL_SYS_PWRGOOD and all other rails.

Thank you and best regards
DudiPupan

threads.title: 820-00850 - CPUGT_PWM1
threads.message:
Do not try to make such a short between signals.
Try to isolate it with a bit of kapton tape, or UV cure paint.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://es.aliexpress.com/wholesale?catId=0&initiative_id=SB_20210329150605&SearchText=uv+cure+paint[/URL]

threads.title: 820-00850 - CPUGT_PWM1
threads.message: Just received the UV Cure paint today. Isolated the short to ground but still got problems with the U7100 I think. I don't exactly know where to Start to Look for the issue.  Would aperciate some help what voltages should be present here. I'm in S0 state but no usb activity or display.

threads.title: 820-00850 - CPUGT_PWM1
threads.message:
CPU is probably dead after such liquid spill.
I don't recommend to waste more time with this board.
